definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Although had been in Shengzhou for close to ten years now, I had never been to Beizhang Mountain and passing there.
sentences.chinese: 到剡县也有将近十年了，可从没去过或路过北璋山。

sentences.english: On the way home, several passersby wished me well.
sentences.chinese: 回去的路上，几个路过的人祝我好运。

sentences.english: " Don't hurt me. "said Odie, " I just pass by. "
sentences.chinese: 请不要伤害我，我只是路过这里。

sentences.english: It was always nice to walk through there.
sentences.chinese: 经常路过那边其实感觉也挺不错的。

sentences.english: The stone head of the Buddha is polished because many people rub it as they go past.
sentences.chinese: 路过游客不断的抚摸使这个石佛的头部显得亮锃锃的。

sentences.english: Senators Kennedy and Packwood shake their heads when they walk past you.
sentences.chinese: 参议员肯尼迪和伍德路过你时，摇摇头。

sentences.english: Maybe just came by and drop in on us.
sentences.chinese: 也许就是路过顺便来看看。

sentences.english: The part-time boy is leafleting to the people passing by.
sentences.chinese: 那个工读生正向路过的人发传单。

sentences.english: Thrice they passed Unsullied guards, standing as if they had been carved from stone.
sentences.chinese: 有三次他们路过无垢者守卫，他们像石雕般站立着。

sentences.english: How are you gonna catch the eye of the girl across the room when you're staring at the ground?
sentences.chinese: 当你盯着地面的时候怎么看路过的靓嫚呢？

sentences.english: On Friday midday I passed by the large Square in front of the Id Kah mosque in Kashgar.
sentences.chinese: 星期五中午我路过艾提尕尔清真寺前的广场。

sentences.english: Ille Hamm was not injured, but the explosion killed nine civilians were wounded passing.
sentences.chinese: 伊勒哈姆没有受伤，但爆炸造成9名路过的平民受伤。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, 18 people walked or biked past her without stopping.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，有18人步行或骑车路过，没有停下来。

sentences.english: When he was driving across a huge bridge, the steel ropes along the edge of the bridge were broken and he fell into the river with his car.
sentences.chinese: 当他开车路过一座大桥时，大桥钢绳断裂。

sentences.english: Times and times, The gone- by train took away my best loves.
sentences.chinese: 多少次，路过的列车带走我曾经的爱恋。

sentences.english: A feller, who passed it, took no glance at it.
sentences.chinese: 路过的伐木工人，连看都不看它一眼。

definition: to run into/to meet (unexpectedly)/to bump into
just by chance/to happen to (just at the right time)/opportune
on the road/on a journey/road surface
by the way/while out doing sth else/conveniently
